sentences.sContent: He will be continuing his education in the US.
I felt too sick to continue.
sentences.sCn: 我感觉很难受，无法继续下去了。

sentences.sContent: ...That’s why leaders continue to manage the present while building toward the big changes of the future...
...The report says America’s urbanization will continue to be the most significant issue affecting the industry...
...I want to continue my studies for their own sake because I love what I am doing...
...and those people continue to reap rich rewards into old age because these days the educated elderly are more productive than the preceding generation...
...Most people of Elizabethan times did not continue beyond grammar school; so...
...This can result in severe penalties that continue long after punishment is completed...
...I believe we are going to continue to increase our share of the market...
...I honestly don’t want to continue the gardening tomorrow...

words.tran: 连续的，持续的；继续的；连绵不断的
连续性；一连串；分镜头剧本
继续；续集；延长；附加部分；扩建物
持续；停留；续篇；诉讼延期
继续；逗留；维持原状（continue的过去分词）

trans.tranOther: to not stop happening, existing, or doing something
